verses.name: Song of Songs 1:1
verses.text: The song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:2
verses.text: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:3
verses.text: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:4
verses.text: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:5
verses.text: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:6
verses.text: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:7
verses.text: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:8
verses.text: If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:9
verses.text: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:10
verses.text: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:11
verses.text: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:12
verses.text: While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:13
verses.text: A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:14
verses.text: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En–gedi.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:15
verses.text: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:16
verses.text: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.

verses.name: Song of Songs 1:17
verses.text: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.
